result.execSummary:
The defendant Kayla R Goemer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.  Fill any prescriptions at the same pharmacy.  Inform Agent of all prescriptions, sign releases.

No contact with: Victim listed in the Criminal Complaint or Co-actor Scott Kudek.  Work toward/maintain employment and/or school combination.  Follow through with any treatement and/or counseling recommended by the Agent.  Provide DNA Sample if not yet already previously obtained.  
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Kayla R Goemer in court, in custody, with attorney Matthew Edward Weil. Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a guilty plea to count # 1. Court performs plea colloquy and finds defendant guilty of count #1. Count #2 is dismissed and read in. State gives sentencing recommendations. Atty Weil makes statements regarding sentencing. Defendant makes Statements. Defendant to be returned forthwith. The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

COUNT #1:

WITHHELD SENTENCE OF:   

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEARS ***CONSECUTIVE TO ANY OTHER SENTENCE***

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Fill any prescriptions at the same pharmacy;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed.
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions, sign releases.
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Work toward/maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with:victim listed in the Criminal Complaint or Co-actor Scott Kudek. 
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done

Credit for time served is set at Zero

COSTS:  $268.00 + $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Kayla R Goemer in court, in custody, with attorney Matthew Edward Weil.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  Court will direct the Sheriff's department to not return the defendant to Robert Elsworht facility until 9/14/16.  Hearing scheduled for September 19, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Faxed back from Robert E. Ellsworth Correctional Center.
Preliminary hearing on September 9, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
filed, to be produced from Robert E. Ellsworth Correctional Center.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.   Defendant to have no contact with business listed in the Criminal Complaint.   Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.

Defendant Kayla R Goemer in court, in custody by video from Robert Ellsworth Correctional, with attorney Matthew Edward Weil.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary Hearing requested within 20  days.   Clerk of Courts Office to prepare Order to Produce from Robert Ellsworth Correctional.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 9, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Informing defendant that proper paperwork including indigency evaluation must be completed before an attorney can be appointed.
Initial appearance on August 25, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
